GSD.description: The _encode_invalid_chars function in util/url.py in the urllib3 library 1.25.2 through 1.25.7 for Python allows a denial of service (CPU consumption) because of an inefficient algorithm. The percent_encodings array contains all matches of percent encodings. It is not deduplicated. For a URL of length N, the size of percent_encodings may be up to O(N). The next step (normalize existing percent-encoded bytes) also takes up to O(N) for each step, so the total time is O(N^2). If percent_encodings were deduplicated, the time to compute _encode_invalid_chars would be O(kN), where k is at most 484 ((10+6*2)^2).

advisories.affected_versions: All versions starting from 1.25.2 up to 1.25.7
advisories.description: The `_encode_invalid_chars` function in `util/url.py` in the urllib3 library for Python allows a denial of service (CPU consumption) because of an inefficient algorithm. The `percent_encodings` array contains all matches of percent encodings. It is not deduplicated. For a URL of length N, the size of `percent_encodings` may be up to O(N). The next step (normalize existing percent-encoded bytes) also takes up to O(N) for each step, so the total time is O(N^2). If `percent_encodings` were deduplicated, the time to compute `_encode_invalid_chars` would be O(kN), where k is at most ((10+6*2)^2).
advisories.not_impacted: All versions before 1.25.2, all versions after 1.25.7
advisories.title: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
